alert.note: Alert for Rawlins; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 10:18AM CDT until May 12 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, in northwest Kansas, Rawlins and Thomas. In southwest Nebraska, Hitchcock. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1017 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Have received reports that the north Beaver Creek is running out of its banks, 7 miles north of Atwood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Atwood, Trenton, Culbertson, Palisade, Rexford, Herndon and Ludell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
